attributes.action: Reduce the fees for late payment of council tax.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: At the moment, if you pay your council tax late, you receive a summons, which costs you £56. If you wait a little longer, the council will slap another £29 on top. My council (Preston CC) claim this is an administrative fee. Bearing in mind the issues with the banks and their charges, why is it legal for the council to charge these extortionate 'admin' fees, but not legal for the banks?
